title: Mathematical Game Theory: A New Approach. (arXiv:2012.01850v3 [econ.TH] UPDATED)
abstract: These lecture notes attempt a mathematical treatment of game theory akin to mathematical physics. A game instance is defined as a sequence of states of an underlying system. This viewpoint unifies classical mathematical models for 2-person and, in particular, combinatorial and zero-sum games as well as models for investing and betting. n-person games are studied with emphasis on notions of utilities, potentials and equilibria, which allows to subsume cooperative games as special cases. The represenation of a game theoretic system in a Hilbert space furthermore establishes a link to the mathematical model of quantum mechancis and general interaction systems.  The notes sketch an outline of the theory. Details are available as a textbook elsewhere.

translated_title: 数学博弈论: 一个新的方法
translated_abstract: 这篇讲义试图用类似于数学物理学的方法对博弈论进行数学处理。一个博弈实例被定义为底层系统状态的序列。这个观点将二人博弈、组合和零和博弈的经典数学模型以及投资和赌博模型统一起来。重点研究了n人博弈的效用、潜力和均衡概念，这使得协作博弈成为特殊情况。通过在希尔伯特空间中表示博弈理论系统，建立了与量子力学数学模型和一般交互系统的联系。这份讲义概述了这一理论的概要，详细信息可在其他教材中找到。
tldr: 这篇讲义提出了一种类似于数学物理学的方法来处理博弈论，将不同类型的博弈统一起来，并突出了效用、潜力和均衡的概念，同时在希尔伯特空间中表示博弈理论系统，建立了与量子力学数学模型和一般交互系统的联系。
en_tdlr: These lecture notes propose a mathematical treatment of game theory akin to mathematical physics, which unifies different types of games and emphasizes concepts of utilities, potentials, and equilibria. The representation of game theoretical systems in a Hilbert space establishes a link to the mathematical model of quantum mechanics and general interaction systems.
